channel.title: Ubuntu file download (via Firefox) error
channel.description: Whenever I try to download something on Ubuntu, in this case, Firefox, I get, for example, this error: [code] Archive: /home/jake/Downloads/utorrent.exe [/home/jake/Downloads/utorrent.exe] End-of-central-directory signature not found. Either this file is not a zipfile, or it constitutes one disk of a multi-part archive. In the latter case the central directory and zipfile comment will be found on the last disk(s) of this archive. zipinfo: cannot find zipfile directory in one of /home/jake/Downloads/utorrent.exe or /home/jake/Downloads/utorrent.exe.zip, and cannot find /home/jake/Downloads/utorrent.exe.ZIP, period. [/code]

item.title: Ubuntu file download (via Firefox) error
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“Javafire, post:8, topic:330953”]1. never use firefox (look up the zeus comprimise botnet)
2. never use ubuntu (annoying as hell)
3. stick with pc, get stardock windowblinds (get it off of a warez site if you hate torrenting e.x. undernation)
4. i suggest that if you use a warez site instead of torrent. alot easier to get rid of viruses that way.[/quote]

Haha, shows how much you know:

  1. That particular botnet you mention is windows only. And there are far more security vulnerabilities using IE than firefox, in fact if you use firefox you are much safer than IE.
  2. I find windows annoying as hell.
  3. Ubuntu runs on a PC.
  4. Downloading ‘warez’ is where you will get viruses, or just stick with linux and never get a virus. Your choice.

[quote=“r0ckstar96, post:7, topic:330953”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=427325.msg3138262#msg3138262 date=1267247001]

No, I mean where do you see it at? In the firefox window or someplace else?

When I went to the Firefox downloads and tried opening the file, it popped up the error message in some Archive window.

Alright, the problem is your archive program then, nothing to do with firefox? What if you open the file browser and go to where the program is downloaded then try to open it? And is it with every file? Maybe you just got a bad one.

edit:
It looks like you downloaded a windows utorrent executable and then tried to open it with an archive program. No wonder it didn’t work. You know linux doesn’t run windows programs right? If you want a torrent program look for one in the program you have called synaptic (a package manager) Personally I like ktorrent.
[/quote]
Thanks! And the errors happened with all but Zip, gzip, RAR, and tar files.[/quote]

That is because for some reason when you try to open things from firefox it opens them all with the Archive program, instead open your downloads folder in your file browser (I think it might be called nautilus) and open them from there.

Read full topic

  1. never use firefox (look up the zeus comprimise botnet)
    2. never use ubuntu (annoying as hell)
  2. stick with pc, get stardock windowblinds (get it off of a warez site if you hate torrenting e.x. undernation)
  3. i suggest that if you use a warez site instead of torrent. alot easier to get rid of viruses that way.

that maybe becuase you don’t understand how to use it, A FF is the best IB going.
[/quote]
i don’t understand to use it and yet i have had it for almost 3 years and got fucking sick of it.[/quote]

Linux is fail proof. FACT.

Read full topic

item.title: Ubuntu file download (via Firefox) error
item.dc:creator: @r0ckstar96 r0ckstar96
item.description:
@r0ckstar96 wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:6, topic:330953”][quote author=r0ckstar96 link=topic=427325.msg3138233#msg3138233 date=1267243879]

No, I mean where do you see it at? In the firefox window or someplace else?

When I went to the Firefox downloads and tried opening the file, it popped up the error message in some Archive window.
[/quote]

Alright, the problem is your archive program then, nothing to do with firefox? What if you open the file browser and go to where the program is downloaded then try to open it? And is it with every file? Maybe you just got a bad one.

edit:
It looks like you downloaded a windows utorrent executable and then tried to open it with an archive program. No wonder it didn’t work. You know linux doesn’t run windows programs right? If you want a torrent program look for one in the program you have called synaptic (a package manager) Personally I like ktorrent.[/quote]
Thanks! And the errors happened with all but Zip, gzip, RAR, and tar files.

Read full topic

item.title: Ubuntu file download (via Firefox) error
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“r0ckstar96, post:5, topic:330953”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=427325.msg3138225#msg3138225 date=1267242721]
No, I mean where do you see it at? In the firefox window or someplace else?
[/quote]
When I went to the Firefox downloads and tried opening the file, it popped up the error message in some Archive window.[/quote]

Alright, the problem is your archive program then, nothing to do with firefox? What if you open the file browser and go to where the program is downloaded then try to open it? And is it with every file? Maybe you just got a bad one.

edit:
It looks like you downloaded a windows utorrent executable and then tried to open it with an archive program. No wonder it didn’t work. You know linux doesn’t run windows programs right? If you want a torrent program look for one in the program you have called synaptic (a package manager) Personally I like ktorrent.

Read full topic

item.title: Ubuntu file download (via Firefox) error
item.dc:creator: @r0ckstar96 r0ckstar96
item.description:
@r0ckstar96 wrote:

Whenever I try to download something on Ubuntu, in this case, Firefox, I get, for example, this error:

Archive:  /home/jake/Downloads/utorrent.exe
[/home/jake/Downloads/utorrent.exe]
  End-of-central-directory signature not found.  Either this file is not
  a zipfile, or it constitutes one disk of a multi-part archive.  In the
  latter case the central directory and zipfile comment will be found on
  the last disk(s) of this archive.
zipinfo:  cannot find zipfile directory in one of /home/jake/Downloads/utorrent.exe or
          /home/jake/Downloads/utorrent.exe.zip, and cannot find /home/jake/Downloads/utorrent.exe.ZIP, period.

Read full topic
